Reviews.Title: “good job”
Reviews.Author: micheal f
Reviews.Content: Front desk and staff was outstanding. Hotel was under renovation at the time but it wasn't a bother. My room had new furniture and nice size flat screen t.v. The place was quite at night and the breakfast was better than i expected. The pool looked clean but i didn't get to go swim. I got a good workout in the gym though. I would recommend this place to friends mainly because the people that worked there seemed to care about how my stay was and always asked if everything was O.K., It was!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaK7605
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I couldn't have a better stay than the one in this hotel. The employees were very nice and met all our wishes and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VPNor
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after reading some reviews and of the location, but to my surprise, it was a great 2 night experience!!! I would definitely stay here again!! Parking is secured and easy-even reserved spots for Priority Club Members-never have seen this before. The hotel is almost done with a renovation and it is very nice! The hotel is definitely an older property, but again, it is up to par with the "new" holiday inn look after this renovation. The rooms are large (except for bathroom) and spacious and come with all the modern Holiday Inn (IHG) amentities. Very Very Clean hotel!!! Great AC, very comfy beds, and VERY VERY good strong water pressure. The staff is very friendly and willing to help in any way they can. From the service stand point, it is that of a four star hotel. Finally, the breakfast buffet is better than average-a full buffet. If you are in the Valley, this is the perfect place as it is in the center of it all. Save your time from searching and stay here, even though it is a bit more than other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Option”
Reviews.Author: dbcoop2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for business I was doing just down the street. This place is definitely not as nice as the average Holiday Inn Express. The beds are comfortable but it's clear they did the minimum amount of renovations to stay competitive in the area. The rooms are kind of cramped and the walls were sort of dirty. Also, the west and northern exposures face the 405 freeway so auto noise can be heard if the room fan is off. The wifi worked good, breakfast was fine and I slept well which is all that matters. I also think it's important to remember that this place is significantly cheaper than nicer options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “scammers”
Reviews.Author: scorpio92064
Reviews.Content: I requested a room change cause of the a/c smelling like a burn rubber and it was cold that night, I was told that its going to be additional charge, I was shocked when the front desk told me that I will paying extra. I was hoping to get a discount but instead they charge me more from the price queted before I checked in. I, family and friends will never stay in this scammers hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: dos7940
Reviews.Content: Standard Holiday Inn Express but a great location if you're traveling by. It's not in the very best neighbor but essentially across the street from the 405 and within a block of the exit. There is also a Taco Bell and a Denny's right next door. Although it’s close to the Freeway, I didn't have a problem with the road noise. The exterior of the hotel is undergoing a makeover and the interior is scheduled for painting. The staff is very friendly. The building is older but well maintained and looks and feels younger that it is.

Reviews.Title: “In case of an emergency don't expect any sympathy”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa L
Reviews.Content: My issue is a customer service issue. As I arrived from the flyaway around 11:00 p.m. on a Friday and checked in for the first time to an Express I quickly went up to my room and started dosing off when I received a phone call not even an hour later in regards to my sister who was involved in a serious automobile accident. I quickly jumped out of bed and ran to the hospital. The next morning I called customer care. They said more than likely the management would understand and be able to either refund my stay or give me a significant discount being that I only occupied my room for an hour or so. I had not heard back from management until Monday around 3:30 p.m. Surprisingly the manager said there was nothing she could do as the maids report indicated a full cleaning. HUH??? changing the sheets and cleaning a toilet is considered a full cleaning. Anyway, she offered no sympathy and ended up charging me a full night's stay. This is definitely a Hotel I will not return to ever again nor recommend to anyone for the lack of customer service that they provided me. I don't wish this upon anyone but if it should happen ask the hotel what they can do if an emergency occurs before you pay them.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: rayl33
Reviews.Content: I've heard Holiday Inn Expresses described as "bare bones" so I was pleasantly surprised to awaken to a decent breakfast set up in the morning. I particularly liked the ample, fluffy eggs. They were doing renovations while I was there, but this didn't result in any inconveniences. The staff was nice. My room was clean and the bathoom was fine and a decent size; my only issue was that it was a bit difficult to seal the shower curtain so that no water leaked out.

Reviews.Title: “Fit Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and staff and room were good. Nicely furnished and facilities were fine. Was pleasantly surprised that my nephew who goes to UC Northridge was just down the road. Convenient to expressway and in a quiet area. No issues with orders or room being too small as cited in other reviews. Area is a bit blah, but hotel itself met our needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: JustcallmeTab
Reviews.Content: This hotel's customer service is the worst I have ever experienced... all the way from the man that ran the desk all the way to the general manager. I travel quite extensively due to my job and I am a Gold Prioirity Rewards member. One of the perks of being a Gold Member is upgrading. I requested an upgrade which was not even acknowledged with no explanation as to why it was not available. My husband, who was with me at the time, is disabled and needs a bath tub to bathe in. When we checked into the room and I started to prepare to give him a bath, I discovered that the tub was damaged at the bottom and it would be rather uncomfortable for my husband to sit in. I went to the front fesk and advised of the damaged tub and the gentleman at the front desk advised that he had no rooms available. The hotel was not even crowded what so ever. I knew that there was no way that it full. Finally, the man advised that he would call his supervisor and see if he could move me to one of the rooms that were empty but taken off the available list. I then asked him where the laundry facilities were and he stated that the hotel did not have one on premises so I asked where a nearby laundromat was. He stated that he would find out and when he called to advise me of what his supervisor said he would give me the location of a laundromat. I went back upstairs and waited for over an hour with no phone call. I called the front desk and was advised that that associate had left for the night and had not said a word about the issue with the tub. The associate said that he would send keys up so that we could move, which he did. After repacking, moving to the new roome cart ,and unpacking, we went downstairs to return the luggage cart and the keys from the priginal room. We asked the associate then where the nearest laundromat was and to our amazement, he stated tyat there was one on the 4th floor!!! I was livid and advised that the other associate had told us that there was not one. I asked for quarters and laundry soap and just as the guy reaches under t he counter to hand me a boix of soap he tries to make excuses that the prior associate had only been employed for 30 days and probably did not know that there was a laundry room on premises. If there was laundry soap under the counter, what would that associate think the laundry soap was for??? By this time, we are looking at three and a half hours of messing with these people. By t he time I got my husband bathed and got my laundry done and got to bed, it was after 1:30 a.m. I had to be up by 6:00 a.m. To make matter worse, I got the general managers name and number and when I contacted her and told her my experience, she said she would look into it and call me back. I never heard back from her. I ca lled her again and she acted as if she did not know what I was talking about and was extremely rude. I advised her that I wanted my points back or something for my compensation. She refused me and acted as if I had nothing to complain about. I asked for her supervisor's information and she told me that she was the head honcho. To make sure that I understood her correctly, I said, "so your the head of Holiday Inn huh?" to which she said yes she was. I did end up calling Holiday Inn's Consumer Complaint dept and eventually got one half of my points back. It's b etter than nothing. I can not believe what horrible service and what a bunch of liars they are.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK stay”
Reviews.Author: CherylandBrett
Reviews.Content: We have always had great success staying in a Holiday Inn but this place was only a so-so. Room was very small, carpet didn't look especially clean. TV remote didn't work-had to go to the lobby for new batteries. Bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was ok although the hot water dispenser was empty. I had to track someone down and ask for her to refill it so I could have my tea. No free paper offered either, I had to go to the desk and request. Was told I got the "last one"! Usually one is left outside our door!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot for visiting AB Brewery”
Reviews.Author: spparkervt
Reviews.Content: Normally stay there when visiting/working at the brewery since my hours require me to be there early, late and everywhere in between. It's a very short drive to the brewery (1/4 mile or so) and you have pretty easy access via the freeway to Sherman Oaks mall aread for restaurants, etc. Not much to eat right at that spot and not sure I'd be walking around too much late at night, but right aroudnd the hotel it's fine. TIP: the closest Starbucks is actually in the Jaguar dealership (inside...no signs but it's there) right down the street (travel away from freeway for about 3 storefronts). It's walkable from the hotel if you can't stand the nasty hotel coffee.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: justredwordz
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing, the room was nicely appointed and extremely comfortable and the amenities are awesome! My 3 children (20/18/14) and I really enjoyed our time here. What a wonderful welcome to California! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: SanFransiscoPaul
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with a lot of character. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable during our stay.We really enjoyed this hotel. The beds were so comfortable. The room was very clean..

Reviews.Title: “Seriously in need of cleaning! (and a night staff that knows what they are doing)”
Reviews.Author: orbusk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other parties from our family for a funeral. Upon arrival we were greeted politely and the check in was smooth. We went up to our room and it was small as other reviews stated. What was not expected was the smell! It took us a bit to figure out what it was and as far as we can figure, it smelled like urine!!! NASTY is all I can say about that. As for the rest of the room, the bathroom was not very clean, the vent was caked with dirt and dust. The corners and baseboards of the room obviously had not been tended to in some time. The walls also had what appeared to be 'splatter' marks on them. We also saw what looked like blood on the elevator wall. The two other parties with us were charged 90 dollars extra than what they booked for online and when they brought it to the attention of the desk the morning of check out, he had no clue what they were talking about nor how to fix it. He said that it must be that the estimated taxes went up?!?!? He then had them wait until the manager could come in so that it could be remedied. This same person was unable to find hot cocoa mix for the beverage area at breakfast. And speaking of breakfast, it was fine.... except there was no fruit as stated there would be. The area this hotel is in is not the best.... We will certainly not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay!!”
Reviews.Author: baby888
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel, stayed 4 nights. Chose this hotel again because it is close to where our family lives. Basic hotel, nothing fancy, but great service. Staff is friendly. Used the outdoor pool this time twice, very clean and nicely landscaped. Used business centre in lobby as well to print boarding pass. Extra towels provided as requested. Pop machine on each floor, snack machine just off lobby. Highly recommended if you are wanted a clean basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David12333012
Reviews.Content: There were unauthorized charges to my credit card which the hotel refuses to correct. After months of misleading me they were going to remove the charges they still have not done do. Now the Manager, Ellen, even after agreeing to remove the charges stated they have no intention of doing so. Very rude and dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Why even have a business center??”
Reviews.Author: AZSoonerOrLater
Reviews.Content: It seems that every one of these low end Holiday Inns that I frequent has a non working printer in the business center. Why bother? Really!!!! This hotel is in desperate need of it's makeover. I have quite enjoyed the "new look" HI but this one has not been renovated, and oh, did I mention that the printer in the business center did not work. Very annoying!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad notes...”
Reviews.Author: KOSacramento
Reviews.Content: Cheesy bedspread in room, tv not good-cuts out basic remote with no ‘last’ or ‘menu’ selection. Spacious room. Microwave and fridge in room. Dressers, table are fine. Light system is bad-lights are very bright and in between the beds so person in other bed couldn’t stay asleep once one light is turned on.Beds are clean and comfy, bathroom is fine and roomy. Cedar roof over pool. Jacuzzi was bad-no thrust in jets, just weak bubbles- worthless as therapy pool.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, good in many ways, but still needs a little work”
Reviews.Author: GHillTraveler
Reviews.Content: I liked the Priority Club parking out front; hadn't seen that amenity before. Front staff was friendly and efficient. Lobby was clean and looked nice. Room looked nice. Bed and bath linens looked new and were quite comfy. Room was fairly quiet; was aware of the freeway traffic noise and the elevator, but neither were bothersome. Bathroom was kind of small, but was clean and otherwise adequate. Only 3 things wrong with the room: drapes had dirty fingerprints which were pretty gross, bottom of bathroom door was "chewed up" (water damage?), and shower drain was a bit slow. I left a note at the front desk about these things, so perhaps they will address them. The inside of the hotel looked recently painted. As for the breakfast in the morning, it was good, tasty, and free. The room itself was $129, which I felt was a bit overpriced. Overall, the place was just fine for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: mad_scotty_dog
Reviews.Content: stayed one night here as a stopover - it does what it says on the tin - it is a HIE - so usual standards: nice room but not fancy, clean, OK pool, reasonable breakfast for little money

Reviews.Title: “Rose Among the Weeds”
Reviews.Author: Patty39
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here to attend our son's college graduation from Cal State Northridge (CSUN). While the neighborhood was mostly industrial and in spots, run down, the hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms had recently been renovated and they were in the process of updating the exterior with not only paint, but granite door frames, etc. The beds were comfortable and felt new as did the pillows. The hotel used bed covers rather than a traditional bedspread - a nice alternative to the germ infested coverings that I immediately remove as soon as i can. The only criticism was the smallish bathroom. But the staff was pleasant and helpful and the daily complimentary breakfast was yummy. We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It ! great Price !”
Reviews.Author: moval
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice. Great Location for people going to Magic Mountain or Universal Studios. The staff were very pleasant and prompt service. The rooms were great and so was the price. They offered a continental breakfast from 6:30 am - 9:00am. Were a family of 4 and we had two doubles beds which seemed more like queen size beds. I would stay here again.... And I would recommend this hotel . Deborah Southern California dsphiggins@charger.net

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: Baxman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is strictly average at best. There is nothing too terrible about it but nothing great about it either. I was booked into the hotel through my work so I didn't research prices in the area however this hotel seems awfully expensive compared to the many other hotels that I have stayed in. The bathrooms are the smallest I think I have ever seen in a hotel. There are nice. Marble all over plus an okay showerhead (I say okay because it is not as great as the Holiday Inn marketing would want you to believe). Really you won't believe how small the bathroom is. The room itself was okay. The beds were actually very comfortable. If you plan on working from your hotel room you might want to think twice about staying here. The wireless internet is fine but the desk doesn't have a decent chair. There is a lounge chair that is way too low to actually work at the desk. This hotel has a strange policy of not honoring the "Do not disturb" sign on the door. It is their policy to check up on each room every day. I don't believe I have ever seen that anywhere else. So much for privacy. The staff is not overly friendly or helpful. I have seen much better front desk staff at many other hotels. The location of hotel is only good if you want close highway access. There are no really good restaraunts in the area. Overall this would be an okay hotel for a quick stop however the high price makes this not even worth it. Unless you really have to stay in this area I would keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “basic room, fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: nonaccidentaltourist
Reviews.Content: There is nothing in the area with rates as low as the Holiday Inn Express, even though the rates were quite a bit higher this time than they were two years ago when I first stayed there. I like it much more than the Best Western on Sepulveda, that's for sure. The HIE has a refrigerator in the room, which I consider a huge plus. I bought juice at the nearby Wal-Mart, for instance, and did not have to float it in the ice bucket to get it cold. As others have noted, the bathrooms are absurdly small, with long toilets that make getting at the hair dryer a feat for an orangutan. A shorter, rounder, toilet would have been a better idea! Another minus is the very loud HVAC unit. I found the beds too soft, and the fluffy mattress top was suffocating. Pillows are marked Soft and Firm, and there are fat ones and normal ones - great to have a variety. The free wireless was reliable and excellent, which is my main criterion when I am in Van Nuys, since I rely on it to do the things I've come to do while there. I used the hotel fax as my printer! A desk chair would be nice, though - I had to pile pillows on the upholstered chair to sit at the desk. I didn't remember that from two years ago, so maybe some rooms do have desk chairs. The hotel is just plain ordinary accommodations. The breakfast is just plain ordinary cold food -cold cereal, fruit, juice, hard boiled eggs, and bread for toasting as well as danish and croissants - think packaged baked goods, not scrumptious. They have instant oatmeal, but without a microwave and less-than-boiling hot water, it doesn't quite work. But the offerings will get you to lunch, and I took an orange up to the room to eat at night. Hard to peel with just a plastic knife, but a welcome snack. There's an In-N-Out Burger a few miles east on Roscoe, if the next-door options - Denny's, Burger King, and Taco Bell - don't entice you. The area seemed fine to me as I strolled to those three fine dining establishments. Denny's is a good place for a hot breakfast. Unless you're buying a Jaguar, you're basically nowhere, but conveniently immediately off the 405.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient access to popular attractions”
Reviews.Author: ICJ
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Holiday Inn Express Van Nuys is that it is just a 15-20 minute drive to Hollywood and surrounding attractions like Universal City. It's a good choice if you're looking for a clean, relatively affordable place to sleep after a day of sightseeing. The complimentary breakfast was adequate and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. On the downside, the bathroom was so small, I could not stand directly in front of the sink because the toilet was in the way. If you're a larger person, you might have difficulty opening and closing the door from inside. The area immediately around the hotel is nothing special, and offers few dining options other than fast-food chains.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced + Shabby”
Reviews.Author: CK-LasVegas
Reviews.Content: Overall a worn and dirty property under renovation. Specifically asked for a room on the top floor; got one on the 5th out of 7 floors; said we wanted peace & quiet, placed in a room on the side they were replacing/repairing the windows - had to close the curtains because the workman otherwise could look right in. The carpeting in the hallway was filthy, not as bad in the room but still dirty + the comforter & blankets were not freshly laundered; at least there were clean sheets. The bathroom is extremely small, there were pieces of wood peeled off the back of the bathroom door; light came in all around the hallway door (put the comforter at the bottom). Stayed a Sat & Sun night @ $112.00 booked directly on the website; was worth maybe 1/2 that at the MOST. The breakfast selection was decent but overall this was not a good experience; we will never stay there again nor recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: YpsiKev
Reviews.Content: Chose HI Express as it was the closest to where I needed to be in the SF Valley. Stayed for 4 nights. Staff friendly, check in was easy. Originally staying in room 502. This room was recently renovated with new paint, carpet, A/C unit. It had the new bedding as well. However, this room had absolutely the smallest bathroom I'd ever seen! The layout of the bath is such, that I hate to say it, but an overweight guest I would think would have problems sitting down on this toilet. You cannot stand in front of the toilet to use the sink (no room), you have to stand to the side. I know you don't go on vacation and spend it in the bathroom, but just FYI. However, be aware that room renovations are in progress 10:30am-5:30PM everyday. I had to ask for a new room, as I was trying to take a nap (jet lag) and couldn't handle the pounding and jackhammering going on above me. I put up with it for 2 days, then asked to switch rooms. The staff was very accomodating, and switched me to room 321 w/o complaint. This room was great, also renovated....and a much larger bathroom. Internet access was wireless and worked fine. They also have pay per minute computers in the lobby for internet access. Breakfast was fine. Didn't use the pool. Fitness room small, but has TV and 3 pieces of new equipment (treadmill, bike, ellipical). This will be an even better hotel once renovations are completed. If you are staying in upcoming weeks or months (however long it takes to finish renovations) I would ask very pointed questions to the staff if the renovations are complete, if not, be sure to get a room on the opposite side of the building. Area is OK (right by the 405), didn't see any safety issues while I was there (even coming in late).....there was a security guard at night. Just use common sense like you would anywhere else. Overall very pleased, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UOT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October. We flew into the Burbank Airport and wanted a hotel that was nearby. We went to the King Tut exhibit at the museum (I highly recommend this!), Six Flags Magic Mountain, and drove the highway from Santa Monica to Malibu. The traffic really can be an eye opener...there was traffic backed up at 5pm on a Saturday. We did eat at the Reel Inn on the Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu...I highly recommend this also, it was a great place for fresh fish! Check-in was a breeze at the hotel...we were in room 614 with one King bed. It was exactly like the pictures previously posted but instead of the second bed, we had a large chair and side table. We were happy with the fridge and the size of the room. The bathroom is a one person bathroom but that is ok. There were undergoing major renovations...looked like they were replacing all the carpet, repainting, etc. The room was very clean. The breakfast was the typical continental breakfast with the addition of warm cinnamon rolls. Very good...there is the Denny's and Taco Bell right next door. We did not use the pool...had pretty gloomy days when we were there. They did have computers in the lobby where you could access the internet for 10min/$1 but we could not get either of the computers to connect. I am a member of their priority club and booked online thru them for $80 a night. We received a copy of the LA Times every morning...including the Sunday paper. Some rooms had the LA Times and others had USA today outside the door. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Fussbudget07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked this inn because it was the closest place to our just-relocated kids' house, and because Trip Advisor had given it a superior review despite its 2-star category. We were delighted to find that Trip Advisor was absolutely right: our large, king-bedded room was immaculately clean, well serviced, and quiet; even though we learned that the hotel is undergoing massive renovations, we never heard a sound. The complimentary buffet breakfast was better than most I've had and the staff couldn't have been more efficient or accommodating, and if you get bored with the sameness of the food, you can walk next door and eat at Denny's. We have already booked another stay for our next trip to CA.

Reviews.Title: “The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet, what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: macmaroon
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at nine different hotels in sixteen days and surprisingly all of them were great (thanks in part to reading reviews from fellow travelers at TripAdvisor). The Holiday Inn Express rated about the middle of the pack out of the hotels we stayed at. We selected this location because it was very convenient for us, as we were visiting relatives who only lived a few blocks away. For three adults, the AAA Rate was $101.47, including taxes. The non-smoking room on the seventh (top) floor was large, and included two beds, a clock radio, two comfy chairs, a table, a large television (could only watch fourteen channels) with remote, a medium-sized refrigerator, a coffeemaker, and an iron and ironing board. The bathroom included a hairdryer, shampoo, lotion, a shower cap, and soap in a dish. The sink was in the bathroom and the shower/bathtub had a handrail and a bathmat. While the toilet was hard to flush, it did have good suction, but seemed to be in the way when using the sink (since the bathroom was small). There were two elevators for this seven-storey hotel, and we never had to wait long no matter if we were in the lobby or on the seventh floor. If you forgot your laptop, they had two Internet access terminals in the lobby for a reasonable fee ($1.00 = ten minutes). Unfortunately, they were quite busy during the whole four nights my family was visiting, but I did managed to use them just the same. The hotel is located off the freeway and is within walking distance to Denny’s, Burger King, and Taco Bell. You will also find that parking is at a bit of a premium, but if you are a Priority Club member, there are a number of spaces right by the door, which I took full advantage of! Overall, we were very pleased with our stay, as the room was clean, comfortable, and quiet. You might find fault with the small bathroom and lack of television channels, but these are minor inconveniences. My family and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bargain”
Reviews.Author: wonkadog
Reviews.Content: Being a visitor to L.A. from the Midwest, I was worried about finding hotels in "safe" locations for my wife and I...this was a winner. It is located right off of a major Interstate (405) and is easy to get to. The hotel was very clean and nice, and they offer a continental breakfast (nothing amazing, but hey, it's free). The staff was all friendly and the parking was free. I'd definitely stay here if I go back to L.A. sometime. The price was excellent for hotels in this area at around $75 or so.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Van Nuys
HotelInfo.Address: 8244 Orion Ave, Los Angeles, CA 91406
